title.value: Tackling the XAI Disagreement Problem with Regional Explanations
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the research paper.
title.quote: Tackling the XAI Disagreement Problem with Regional Explanations

extractions.description: This paper addresses the XAI Disagreement Problem which arises due to different explainability methods offering conflicting insights on model behavior. The paper introduces a novel approach using Functional Decomposition (FD) to reduce feature interactions and provide regional explanations, demonstrated on both toy and real datasets.

type.justification: The research presents a theoretical framework for understanding and addressing the XAI Disagreement Problem through Functional Decomposition and regional explanations.
type.quote: Our partial mitigation of the disagreement problem is inspired by Hybrid Interpretable Models...

name.justification: The paper primarily focuses on issues related to explainability in AI models, specifically addressing the XAI Disagreement Problem.
name.quote: To address these concerns, the field of eXplainable AI (XAI) was introduced, and various post-hoc explanation methods were proposed to provide insight into complex model behaviors.

name.justification: The paper is situated in the broader context of machine learning, discussing model behaviors, interpretability, and explainability.
name.quote: The Machine Learning paradigm is growing in popularity in data-centric domains.

name.justification: The paper introduces and discusses the concept of Functional Decomposition as a method to address the disagreement problem.
name.quote: In this work, we approach the Disagreement Problem from the point of view of Functional Decomposition (FD).

name.justification: Random Forests is mentioned as a model type that the paper provides post-hoc explanations for and uses in experimental demonstrations.
name.quote: ...the observation that different post-hoc explanation methods disagree on the local/global behavior of models. This is not necessarily an issue...

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not claim to have contributed to the development of Random Forests but rather uses it as a tool within their study.
is_contributed.quote: ...there are rising concerns regarding the black-box nature of the performant models e.g. Random Forests...

is_executed.justification: Random Forests are used in demonstrations and experiments to show the FD-tree's effectiveness in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We show on six real datasets that explaining Random Forests and Gradient Boosted Trees on well-chosen regions can increase the agreement between post-hoc explainers.

is_compared.justification: Random Forests are compared with other models such as Gradient Boosted Trees regarding the explanations provided by different XAI methods.
is_compared.quote: ...explainability methods provide insight into Random Forests and Gradient Boosted Trees.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title is provided for Random Forests authored by Breiman in 2001.

name.justification: Gradient Boosted Trees is mentioned alongside Random Forests as a model type used in their analysis and experiments.
name.quote: The Machine Learning paradigm is growing in popularity in data-centric domains... Gradient Boosted Trees (Friedman, 2001).

is_contributed.justification: Gradient Boosted Trees are existing models referenced in the research, not contributed by this paper.

is_executed.justification: Gradient Boosted Trees are used in experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.
is_executed.quote: ...six real datasets that explaining Random Forests and Gradient Boosted Trees on well-chosen regions can increase the agreement between post-hoc explainers.

is_compared.justification: Gradient Boosted Trees are compared with Random Forests for understanding model behaviors explained by various XAI methods.
is_compared.quote: ..methods disagree on the local/global behavior of models like ... Gradient Boosted Trees.

referenced_paper_title.value: Greedy function approximation: a gradient boosting machine
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is by Friedman in 2001, which is relevant to Gradient Boosted Trees.

name.justification: The Adults Income Dataset is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for demonstrating the proposed method.
name.quote: The UCI classification datasets Adults, Default-Credit, and Marketing were employed while, for regression tasks...

referenced_paper_title.justification: It is standard to assume common datasets like Adults from UCI without explicit citation in the paper.

name.justification: The Default-Credit Dataset is used for experiments in the paper.
name.quote: The UCI classification datasets Adults, Default-Credit, and Marketing were employed while...

referenced_paper_title.justification: It is standard to recognize that this dataset is fetched from the UCI repository without specific citation details.

name.justification: The Marketing dataset is utilized in experiments described by the paper.
name.quote: The UCI classification datasets Adults, Default-Credit, and Marketing were employed while...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The repository is where such datasets are commonly sourced for research.

name.justification: BikeSharing is one of the real datasets used in the research paper to illustrate experimentation on their proposed method.
name.quote: ...the UCI dataset BikeSharing, Kin8nm, and the StatLib dataset California were investigated.

referenced_paper_title.justification: It is understood that such datasets are drawn from UCI without detailed citation.

name.justification: Kin8nm is mentioned as part of the experimental datasets applied with their new approach.
name.quote: ...the UCI dataset BikeSharing, Kin8nm, and the StatLib dataset...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The UCI repository is the known source for Kin8nm dataset availability.

name.justification: California Housing is used as part of the regression tasks in their experimental analysis.
name.quote: ...the UCI dataset BikeSharing, Kin8nm, and the StatLib dataset California were investigated.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The StatLib repository is directly mentioned as the source for the California dataset.

name.justification: SHAP is explicitly cited in terms of computing Shapley values for explanations in the paper.
name.quote: The next post-hoc explainer comes from Cooperative Game Theory... in the library SHAP (Lundberg and Lee, 2017)...

referenced_paper_title.value: A Unified Approach to Interpreting Model Predictions
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the original paper associated with the introduction of SHAP values authored by Lundberg and Lee (2017).
